pesticide.PPE: Applicators and handlers must wear: Long-sleeved shirt and long pants; Waterproof gloves; Shoes plus socks. Mixers/loaders and applicators must wear a dust/mist filtering respirator meeting NIOSH standards of at least N-95, R-95, or P-95. Repeated exposure to high concentrations of microbial proteins can cause allergic sensitization. Follow the manufacturer’s instructions for cleaning/maintaining PPE. If no such instructions for washables, use detergent and hot water. Keep and wash PPE separately from laundry.

Active_Ingredients.name: Bacillus thuringiensis subspecies galleriea, strain SDS-502, fermentation solids, spores and insecticidal toxins

Safety_Information.general_Info: Harmful if absorbed through the skin, inhaled, or swallowed. Avoid contact with skin, eyes, or clothing or breathing dust. Wash thoroughly with soap and water after handling and before eating, drinking, chewing gum, using tobacco, or using the toilet. Remove and wash contaminated clothing before reuse.
Safety_Information.if_Swallowed: Call a poison control center or doctor immediately for treatment advice. Have person sip a glass of water if able to swallow. Do not induce vomiting unless told to by a poison control center or doctor. Do not give anything by mouth to an unconscious person.
Safety_Information.if_Inhaled: Move person to fresh air. If person is not breathing, call 911 or an ambulance, then give artificial respiration, preferably mouth-to-mouth if possible. Call a poison control center or doctor for further treatment advice.
Safety_Information.if_On_Skin: Take off contaminated clothing. Rinse skin immediately with plenty of water for 15-20 minutes. Call a poison control center or doctor for treatment advice.
Safety_Information.physician_Note: Have the product container or label with you when calling a poison control center or doctor, or when going for treatment. For emergency information concerning this product, call the National Pesticide Informaiton Center (NPIC) at 1-800-858-7378 seven days a week, 6:30 am to 4:30 pm. Pacific Time (NPIC website: www.nplc.orst.edu). During other times, call your poison control center at 1-800-222-1222.
